main event: A delta-shaped object with flashing red stripes was observed standing still in the sky over Los Angeles, California on May 17, 1956.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for the entire 20-minute observation period.
The observers initially thought the object was a star, but later determined it was not.
Six other people in addition to the main observer witnessed the object.
The object was reported to air defense sites in the area, but no further action was recommended.
The sighting was ultimately determined to be an astronomical phenomenon, likely the planet Venus.
sighted object: delta-shaped object with flashing red stripes
witnesses: engineer for Bendix Co. and 6 others
